overview:
This class allows you interact with Cloud Datastore.

First, install @google-cloud/datastore with npm:

$ npm install --save @google-cloud/datastore

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to @google-cloud/datastoreâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var datastore = require('@google-cloud/datastore')();

Elsewhere

var datastore = require('@google-cloud/datastore')({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to @google-cloud/datastore are outlined in our Authentication guide.

params.name: projectId
params.description: The ID of the project against which to make the request.

params.name: readOptions
params.description:
The options for this lookup request.

This object should have the same structure as ReadOptions

params.name: keys
params.description:
Keys of entities to look up.

This object should have the same structure as Key

params.name: found
params.description:
Entities found as ResultType.FULL entities. The order of results in this field is undefined and has no relation to the order of the keys in the input.

This object should have the same structure as EntityResult

params.name: missing
params.description:
Entities not found as ResultType.KEY_ONLY entities. The order of results in this field is undefined and has no relation to the order of the keys in the input.

This object should have the same structure as EntityResult

params.name: deferred
params.description:
A list of keys that were not looked up due to resource constraints. The order of results in this field is undefined and has no relation to the order of the keys in the input.

This object should have the same structure as Key

params.name: projectId
params.description: The ID of the project against which to make the request.

params.name: partitionId
params.description:
Entities are partitioned into subsets, identified by a partition ID. Queries are scoped to a single partition. This partition ID is normalized with the standard default context partition ID.

This object should have the same structure as PartitionId

params.name: readOptions
params.description:
The options for this query.

This object should have the same structure as ReadOptions

params.name: query
params.description:
The query to run.

This object should have the same structure as Query

params.name: gqlQuery
params.description:
The GQL query to run.

This object should have the same structure as GqlQuery

params.name: batch
params.description:
A batch of query results (always present).

This object should have the same structure as QueryResultBatch

params.name: query
params.description:
The parsed form of the GqlQuery from the request, if it was set.

This object should have the same structure as Query

params.name: projectId
params.description: The ID of the project against which to make the request.

params.name: transaction
params.description: The transaction identifier (always present).

params.name: projectId
params.description: The ID of the project against which to make the request.

params.name: transaction
params.description: The transaction identifier, returned by a call to {@link Datastore.BeginTransaction}.

params.name: projectId
params.description: The ID of the project against which to make the request.

params.name: mode
params.description:
The type of commit to perform. Defaults to TRANSACTIONAL.

The number should be among the values of Mode

params.name: transaction
params.description: The identifier of the transaction associated with the commit. A transaction identifier is returned by a call to {@link Datastore.BeginTransaction}.

params.name: mutations
params.description:
The mutations to perform.

When mode is TRANSACTIONAL, mutations affecting a single entity are applied in order. The following sequences of mutations affecting a single entity are not permitted in a single Commit request:

  • insert followed by insert
  • update followed by insert
  • upsert followed by insert

  • delete followed by update

    When mode is NON_TRANSACTIONAL, no two mutations may affect a single entity.

    This object should have the same structure as Mutation

params.name: mutationResults
params.description:
The result of performing the mutations. The i-th mutation result corresponds to the i-th mutation in the request.

This object should have the same structure as MutationResult

params.name: indexUpdates
params.description: The number of index entries updated during the commit, or zero if none were updated.

params.name: projectId
params.description: The ID of the project against which to make the request.

params.name: keys
params.description:
A list of keys with incomplete key paths for which to allocate IDs. No key may be reserved/read-only.

This object should have the same structure as Key

params.name: keys
params.description:
The keys specified in the request (in the same order), each with its key path completed with a newly allocated ID.

This object should have the same structure as Key

methods.name: Mutation
methods.description: A mutation to apply to an entity.

params.name: insert
params.description:
The entity to insert. The entity must not already exist. The entity key's final path element may be incomplete.

This object should have the same structure as Entity

params.name: update
params.description:
The entity to update. The entity must already exist. Must have a complete key path.

This object should have the same structure as Entity

params.name: upsert
params.description:
The entity to upsert. The entity may or may not already exist. The entity key's final path element may be incomplete.

This object should have the same structure as Entity

params.name: delete
params.description:
The key of the entity to delete. The entity may or may not already exist. Must have a complete key path and must not be reserved/read-only.

This object should have the same structure as Key

params.name: baseVersion
params.description: The version of the entity that this mutation is being applied to. If this does not match the current version on the server, the mutation conflicts.

params.name: key
params.description:
The automatically allocated key. Set only when the mutation allocated a key.

This object should have the same structure as Key

params.name: version
params.description: The version of the entity on the server after processing the mutation. If the mutation doesn't change anything on the server, then the version will be the version of the current entity or, if no entity is present, a version that is strictly greater than the version of any previous entity and less than the version of any possible future entity.

params.name: conflictDetected
params.description: Whether a conflict was detected for this mutation. Always false when a conflict detection strategy field is not set in the mutation.

params.name: readConsistency
params.description:
The non-transactional read consistency to use. Cannot be set to STRONG for global queries.

The number should be among the values of ReadConsistency

params.name: transaction
params.description: The identifier of the transaction in which to read. A transaction identifier is returned by a call to {@link Datastore.BeginTransaction}.
